version_description:
These features require upgrading to Cloud Station 2.2 (for DSM 4.3) or Cloud Station 3.0 (for DSM 5.0)
-Folders can now be selected on multiple DiskStations
-It’s now possible to see which files are being synced, the progress and at what speed

-Fixed some issues related to iOS 7
-Minor bug fixes

． We've added a "Recently opened" tab to easily retrieve frequently used documents
． For more security, password changes in DSM now require to re-link DS cloud
． Unicode domain names (also known as IDN) are now supported
． Minor bug fixes

． Files can now be directly uploaded to your DiskStation from other cloud providers with the Document Provider (requires iOS 8)
． Fixed a sync issue in subfolders of a non-admin user's home folder
． Minor bug fixes and usability improvements

． Fixed an issue causing the sync to remain in an uncompleted state after deleting a file on the DiskStation
． Minor bug fixes

． A notification is sent when files have finished syncing in the background
． Improved the battery usage of Geofences
． Geofences can now be set up directly with a map
． Improved the certificate verification process to detect any updates on the D

． 64-bit support for better performance
． Fixed an issue preventing sharing files located at the root level
． Minor bug fixes and usability enhancements

． Support for iOS 8 Action extension allows you to save files from other apps to DS cloud
． Integrated 2-step verification (requires Cloud Station Server 4.0 or above)
． Upgraded image library to support GIF viewing

Added support to display read-only folder permission
Added support to save iOS Notes files to DS cloud (iOS 9 excluded)
Fixed an issue where NFD-normalized files might lead to conflict
Fixed an issue where the Action extension "Save to DS cloud"

． Upgraded to be compatible with Cloud Station Server in DSM 6.0 RC onward
． Fixed an orientation issue with annotations in PDFs

． Fixed a compatibility issue that prevents DS cloud from synchronizing with Cloud Station Server in DSM 6.0 RC
． Fixed an issue where file names ending in a dot (.) or a space cannot be synchronized

Known issue with upgrade:
． With an empty
． Fixed an upgrade compatibility issue that may lead to database corruption

． Upgraded to be compatible with Cloud Station 4.2.0
． Added support for one-way sync
． Added support for passcode protection
． Added support for creating a new folder in DS cloud when sharing a file from other apps
． Fixed issues with the act
． Enhanced connection security for first time login

1. Fixed an issue where stamps function may cause unexpected crash.
2. Fixed an issue where files with special characters are unable to synced under iOS 10.3.
1. Fixed an issue where root folders containing compound characters cannot be synced on iOS 10.3 and above.

1. Supports previewing and viewing the new image format HEIF brought by iOS 11
2. Supports the newly added option to automatically convert the HEIF images added from albums to JPEG format

1. Updated Synology's terms and conditions for EU data privacy compliance. 
2. Optimized the compatibility with iPhone X and iOS 11.
3. Terminated the support for the built-in PDF editor. Users can still use third-party apps (e.g., Adobe A
